meanings.definition: Assign a task to someone outside of one's organization or group.
meanings.sent1: She decided to outask the project to a freelance designer.
meanings.sent2: It is common for companies to outask certain projects to external vendors.
meanings.sent3: The team leader joked that he would outask the difficult assignment to his cat.
meanings.sent4: Outasking the responsibility felt like passing a hot potato to someone else.
meanings.sent5: The decision to outask the project proved to be a wise move in the end.

meanings.definition: To delegate a task to someone else.
meanings.sent1: He always prefers to outask the more tedious tasks to his assistant.
meanings.sent2: When overwhelmed with work, it's a good idea to outask some responsibilities.
meanings.sent3: She playfully threatened to outask the boring paperwork to her pet parrot.
meanings.sent4: Outasking the task was like passing the baton in a relay race.
meanings.sent5: The manager decided to outask the project to a capable team member.
